The door to the stasis pod is flung open as the occupant looks out 
into th=
e world for the first time.  The occupant grabs the side of 
the stasis pod=
 with his left hand and pulls himself up.  He quickly 
jumps out of the pod=
 and looks around him.

"Blasted Sparks, where am I?"

He quickly went back=
 to his ship and checked the scanners.  The long 
range scanners were damag=
ed in the crash, but the short ranged still 
worked and they revealed nothi=
ng.  No intelligent life was within 
fifty miles which obviously meant one =
thing to the occupant that no 
longer occupied the ship.  He was all alone =
on this world!

He started to panic while he looked around.  What could he =
do?  Maybe 
he could get back in the stasis pod and blast out of here and s=
earch 
for a new planet?  No that wouldn't work; the stasis pod didn't have=
 
enough energy to get out of the atmosphere.  He quickly checked the 
onbo=
ard communication unit.  Broken!  Obviously he couldn't call far 
enough fo=
r help.  He finally realized that his only hope was to 
survive.  The first=
 thing you need to survive is shelter.

The bot looked around and noticed s=
ome hills off in the distance.  If 
there were some hills, maybe there woul=
d be some caves or caverns or 
something that he could survive in.   So it =
was decided he thought.  
He would walk to the hills and hope to find shelt=
er.  

He grabbed the side of his stasis pod and started to drag it along 
=
with him.  It was heavy, but inside there was short range scanners 
and eve=
n a few weeks worth of food.  The journey to the hills would 
be long, but =
at least it was a way for him to survive.

ough the atmosphere the metal

trail

ody started to
